name: Life of the Party (Bard 17 / Fighter 16 / Rogue 7) - halfling
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I've developed a fondness for party friendly builds recently.

Bard / Fighter / Rogue isn't a particularly well investigated combination with only 5 such builds in the ECB archives and one of Max's builds in our forum. 

It is great for parties, and noted builders such as Mithdradates,  Grimnir77 and Maximillan Kane have utilised this class combination previously.

The concept of avoiding / minimising multi-class experience penalties by setting the favored class low also hasn't been thoroughly investigated either. 

The only build I've found so far that has utilised this concept is found Grimnir77's Bloodaxe the DEXtrous (Rogue 18/Fighter 6/Bard 16).

Maybe you ladies and gentlemen know of some more builds who use this concept too?

Anyway I've been working on a halfling Bard / Fighter / Rogue build. 

I've called it Life of the Party, because it brings a lot to any party:

- tank damage with 400+hp, high dex AC, evasion, equip a large shield for extra AC when needed
- do damage with 42 base AB, ITWF kukri, 4d6 sneak attack with 6-7 APR, WS/EWS
- detect enemies with the spot skill (listen is an alternative)
- disable opponents with improved knockdown, preventing them from going to the back lines
- buff teammates or yourself with bard song, improved invisibility, haste, keen weapon, cat's grace/bull's strength, mage armor, protection from evil etc...
- reduce enemy's AC with both curse song and taunt (-5 + -6 = up to -11 AC)
- disable lots of traps, set deadly traps, open some locks, UMD, some search as well
- no multiclass exp penalties
- ranged attack isn't bad either, at 40 base AB + sneak attack/bard song damage, which could be situationally useful if you don't actually want to tank for whatever reason.

Anyway am keen for some suggestions to improve the build further, it looks like a nice one to me, and a fun one too. 

Bardic progression looks a little slow (sometimes you want all the good stuff, now!) but not sure what I can do to improve that, aside from dropping fighter for CoT

WoG players will also probably want craft wand in this build likely at level 24 when they obtain level 4 bard spells and improved invisibility with all the dispel and Mord spamming going on. Probably reasonable to drop toughness for this, but if you got a mage to make you wands you're laughing.

Lingering song would have also been nice too.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: One variant would be to take 2 fewer Fighter and Bard for 4 more Rogue, basically trading Called Shot for Crippling Strike and more Sneak Attack dice and more skill points.  Also, you could trade Toughness for Lingering Song.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Not bad, Orion.  Pretty much a jack of all trades.  However, I do suggest you change the name since Life of the Party was taken by Tattoed Monk.  It is a Cleric 23/Bard17, so he provides more "life" with his healing, raise deads, and resurrections.

I would be tempted to find a way to get 20 Bards in this mix (you're only 3 levels shy!) so you may acquire Lasting Inspiration.  Since you're dex based, and you gain neither Lasting nor Epic Dodge, your party might be non-plussed.  This would require some feat reconfig, like removing Toughness and Called Shot from Epics.  

Be that as it may, this build is totally playable and should excell in any party.  

Cheers!

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
A bard that works also as a rogue and a seasoned fighter. Great!

Weapon specialization helps a lot in doing damage, especially in bard/PM or dex bards, as bards don't have darkfire or flame weapon.
Going DEX helps also getting rid of that still spell feat, that is almost a must jn STR bards.

If you want to take craft wand or lingering song (great addition if lasting inspiration cannot be obtained), in my humble opinion you can swap kukri for shortsword or dagger, that are available from rogue and can be dual wielded also by little ones (although they don't have the same critical range as kukris), so weap. prof exotic will not be needed.

EDIT: this may be the idea for the next team, as the current one is quickly ending its quests....or not? ;)
I have already an idea on what should I play: half orc fighter.bard.RDD!
